thread.title: 7 things to know now: Man drowns family; ‘Star Wars’ crashes...
thread.title_full: 7 things to know now: Man drowns family; ‘Star Wars’ crashes... | www.ajc.com

author: Debbie Lord
title: 7 things to know now: Man drowns family; ‘Star Wars’ crashes...
text:
Here's a roundup of news trending across the nation and world today.
What to know now:
Father kills family : An Arizona man drove his estranged wife and three children into a lake near Phoenix Sunday, intentionally killing them all, authorities are now saying. Glenn Edward Baxter, 27, his wife, Danica, 24, and their children -- Nazyiah, 2, Zariyah, 1, and Reighn, 3, -- drown when Baxter drove the family SUV into Tempe Town Lake.
Webb as an independent : Jim Webb, the former senator who is running for the for the Democratic Party’s nomination for president says he’s considering running as an independent. Webb is expected to make the announcement at a Tuesday 1 p.m. (ET) press conference. According to recent polling, 2 percent of registered Democrats say they support Webb.
>> Read more trending stories
U.S. plane hit in Afghanistan : A U.S. F-16 pilot was forced to make an unscheduled landing a week ago in Afghanistan when his plane was hit by small-arms fire. According to the Pentagon, one of the plane’s stabilizer was damaged, but the pilot was able to return to Bagram Airfield where he landed the plane without incident.
Justin Trudeau headed for victory in Canada, national broadcaster projects https://t.co/tlPd3gEum9 pic.twitter.com/OLjXmdK6eG
— The New York Times (@nytimes) October 20, 2015 New Canadian PM : The new prime minister of Canada has a familiar name and a lot of support. Justin Trudeau, son of Canadian political icon Pierre Trudeau, was elected in a liberal landslide as his party ousted Stephen Harper’s Conservative Party after 10 years in power. Liberals received 39.5 percent of the overall vote compared to 32 percent for the Conservatives. Take a look below at the new prime minister when he was an 18-year-old student.
CIA director hacked : A hacker said to be a high school student claims he gained access to the personal email accounts of the director of the CIA and the secretary of Homeland Security. The FBI is investigating the claim after online contact lists and other documents allegedly from the AOL account of CIA Director John Brennan were posted online. The hacker also posted personal information from the Comcast billing account of Jeh Johnson, secretary of Homeland Security.
CIA director's private email was hacked by a high-school student, reports say: https://t.co/FNVHZ67Xvl pic.twitter.com/vNaaN0BrlL
— MarketWatch (@MarketWatch) October 20, 2015 And one more
You loved the original, you flipped for the one with almonds, now Hershey’s is offering something new -- Hershey's Kisses Deluxe . The new treat has a hazelnut center and is twice the size of a regular Hershey’s Kiss. You’ll have to wait a couple of weeks to get it. The Deluxe is set to hit store shelves on Nov. 5.
In case you missed it
If you watched “Monday Night Football” this week you may have seen the trailer for the next installment of the “Star Wars” franchise. After the sneak peek at “Star Wars: Episode VII—The Force Awakens,” tickets for the movie went on sale causing ticket sites to crash . Check out the trailer below. Oh, and the Philadelphia Eagles beat the New York Giants 27-7.
